page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: {LANDSCAPE} This part of mid-Antrim is situated right in the middle of Ulster's most fertile and prosperous farming regions. {RELIEF} This area is equally divided between a flat lowland belt (c.60m contour line) and an upland plateau (c.130m).The highest point is at Roslin Hill(138.7m). {SLEMISH} The main focus of attention is Slemish mountain(448m) lying to the N.E. of this area.It was on this solitary extinct volcano that Patrick,Ireland's patron saint, is said to have herded swine. {DRAINAGE} The main river is the Rv. Braid, noted for its fish. There are also two burns,the Deerfin and the Devenagh.At the lowest levels there is frequent flooding,resulting in a substantial area of uncultivated bog,used only for rough grazing.
